Reviews.Title: “avoid this one a hotel of horrors”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerIsleOfWight
Reviews.Content: my 2 friends and i booked this hotel for its location to the wembley arena for the strictly come dancing live tour ..... and it was a strictly hotel of horrors ... on arrival in the tatty entrance sent alarm bells ringing but what was to great us in room 34 was beyond belief after trawling through dust sheets on the stairs due to the builders being in and up the vertical stairs in to the attic room .. we opened the door to be greated with the following ... curtains hanging off the rails the head board hanging off exposing nails .massive hole in the well threadbare carpet ,wires hanging out of the phone socket ;[ only one working socket ,lights that never lite up at all ,but the horror of horrors was a door leading off the bathroom as we opened it we were met with a loft space filled up with builders rubbish ,old chairs,old t v sets ,xmas paper and much much more .. if a young child had gone into this space i dread to think what could happened in the wardrobe some 1 had written ; s..t hole : and it was .....

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, in need of an update but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: ahilton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with Mum, and generally found the price we paid for a hotel this close to London reasonable. Our room had a couple of minor issues. The drawers needed a wipe out and the TV remote was missing but these were easily resolved. The hotel could do with a bit of an update but in regards to cleanliness we had no problems at all. One other slightly annoying thing was that the Wifi didn't connect from our room, but if you are just checking emails quickly then sitting in the lobby is fine! Breakfast was basic, (cereal, toast and jam, tea and juice) but again considering the price that we paid I didn't really expect much more. Staff were friendly and helpful, very good service with this. About 5 minutes walk from Wembley Central Tube, about 30 mins to London on the Tube, so close enough to explore the capital. Overall, would stay here again if the price was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Pepperpouch
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable dirty and disgusting cannot believe they can get away with promoting this dirty flee bitten pit!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: fran c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple had rooms here for the weekend of the NFL game at Wembley. The rooms are tiny and dirty and the website is completely inaccurate. There was no remote control for the tv, no hairdryer, no phone, not even a plug in the sink! We could hear everything from the next room. Avoid this hotel at all costs, truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: webb930
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends for a concert at Wembley, the location for the stadium was good and the high street is right outside and taxi office right outside, However the room was in a bad state and needed to be refurbished completely, the curtains were hanging of the tracks, the carpet had not been hovered and i didnt want to take my shoes off! the bathroom was clean, We were given 1 hand towel, each no bath towel or bath mat, so when i showered had to use my pjs to stand on when I got out! Did not use the bar, breakfast was a nightmare, had to queue to get into the breakfast room, and was really disorganised, there was toast or cereal tea or coffee, the breakfast room was very small and set out badly, I appreciate the hotel was busy but we had to sit a dirty table to eat and cleared it ourselves,

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but very low quality”
Reviews.Author: MartinAl79
Reviews.Content: The only pro with this hotel is the price. Besides that there is nothing good to say about this place. The rooms are filthy, standards are rock bottom, and the breakfast is literally the worst I have ever eaten in my whole life. Stay away from this hotel - trust me.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't expect much it's fine!”
Reviews.Author: NoraCaithness
Reviews.Content: Had read so many reviews about this place we were dreading it! On arrival, the place seems fine and service was ok. The decor's tired and outdated and the place needs a wee make-over. However, if you look beyond that to it's great location for Wembley Stadium and the cheap price considering it's London and you realise that, for one night, it's ok! Yes plugs may be dodgy, the rooms very basic, there's definitely no luxuries and breakfast left a wee bit to be desired but we were so glad to walk passed the thousands queueing for trains after the concert at Wembley and in 10 minutes we were tucked up in bed!!! Alas, the noisy trains woke us frequently during the night but that was due to location of our room - our friends in another room close by heard nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about all”
Reviews.Author: black-saturn
Reviews.Content: I booked this room by telephone 6 months previous to when I was staying there. When I booked I was told that a twin room would be Â£79. However, on check in I was told it was Â£99. I enquired about the price increase and they said they didn't know where I got the idea it was going to be Â£79. The room was quite small and extremely hot and stuffy. Both the taps in the bathroom only gave out hot water and there was a foul stagnant water smell coming from the sink. The TV didn't work and there was no kettle. I went to reception at 11.15pm after spending 10 hours on my feet at a Take That concert at Wembley Stadium and was told someone would bring one. No one brought a kettle. There were suspicious looking wires hanging out of the walls and dodgy looking electric fittings. The breakfast was just cereal, toast, tea, coffee and fruit juice served by some very miserable looking waitresses. On their website it says it's a 10 minute walk from Wembley Stadium. All I can say is thats the longest 10 minute walk I've ever been on. It was a 45 minute walk and we were walking quite fast. On the plus side it is in a good area for concerts and events at Wembley and a 5 minute walk from Wembley Central tube station. You can hear the conversations of everyone staying in this hotel. Couple that with it being very near train lines, on a flight path and near a main road and the clunking pipes all night don't expect to get any sleep. The stall don't seem interested in helping you and are extremely miserable. But then so would I be if I worked there. You don't get what you pay for at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: famousdaisy5
Reviews.Content: unfortunatly our stay here was dissapointing to say the least, cost us Â£135 to stay here for 2 nights, where do i beginning, well firstly the car park was more like a squeeze your car in if you can park, they was a massive skip plonked to the side of it, and old matteresses and beds lying to the side of it, and they were truely awful, when we did check into our room,oh my god, they was damp spots up the wall, the room stunk like damp, there was food stains all over the walls, wires along the floor, the carpets were sticky, only two out of the 6 sockets worked, the shower only worked when the people in the rooms around us werent using there showers, the walls were paper thin, and the doors to all the rooms were not secure at all there were huge gaps under the door and you could here everything and everyone, when the person in the next room when to the bathroom, ie using the shower and the toliet, you could here everything and i mean everything, the room up above us had very squeeky floor boards as thats all you could here all the time. we choose to stay at this hotel as it was close to wembley arena, 10 minutes walk, they are plenty of shops and resturants around the area, they were the only good things, next time it will be some where like travel lodge id rather spend more, i would recommend to anyone,

Reviews.Title: “"Room 24" The Broom Cupboard”
Reviews.Author: Devon_Lass20
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were visiting Wembley Arena for an event. On reading the details on the website and looking at the photo's, the hotel seemed a value for money option. The photo's made the hotel rooms to look very much like Premier Inn or Travelodge. The reality was very different, our room was only slightly wider than the double bed and was very cramped. The door was hanging off of the single wardrobe and each curtain was holding on for dear life by about 3 hooks and I'm surprised they didn't come down with the weight of the dust on them. All the walls were badly scuffed and marked and looked in desperate need of a lick of paint. As mentioned in other reviews, there was no remote control for the tv, the walls were very thin and we could hear next doors conversation and no doubt they could hear ours. The carpet was not clean especially around the edges and there was at least 3 cobwebs hanging from the ceiling. The breakfast was very basic, just Cornflakes and toast - which was made with soggy bread which must of been frozen. You could have a cooked breakfast for an extra Â£4.95, but after seeing the state of our room we decided that we'd give it a miss. We appreciate that this is a more budget hotel but I've stayed in this type of rated hotel before and they have never been like this. What does it take to just tidy the room up by cleaning, painting walls, re-hanging the curtains and fixing the wardrobe door. It was a shame as on a positive note the hotel is ideally situated for Wembley Stadium and Arena.

Reviews.Title: “O.k for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: SarahMLeeW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were going to watch the cup final and its location is excellent to the ground. There was bo parking spaves when we arrived an the receptionist told us to pay for parking about 5 minutes walk from the hotel so we did a deal with the garage to park there luckily. I found the lady quite rude on reception. The rooms are standard o.k for 1 night but no more. Breakfast was shocking toast and cornflakes (thank god for service stations). It was hard to communicate with staff.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: clarestudent
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the Ibis in Wembley the week before, which is spotless and modern. After reading the reviews on this site I wasn't sure what to expect of the Euro hotel. I was actually pleasantly surprised - friendly staff, characterful, clean rooms. Nice shower. A little noisy at night outside, but can't blame the hotel for that! The transport links into town are excellent (better than the Ibis actually). Not the best part of town, but not bad and I was OK walking home at 9 at night ( I am a lone female). Would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Wembley Stadium, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen068
Reviews.Content: The room was quite nice. The bed was comfy. The gentlemen who checked us in and out was friendly. The location is good for Wembley Stadium and also close to Wembley Central tube station so easily accessible from central London. Breakfast was a pretty typical continental, no croissant though which at some places I've really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “About as Euro as the pound!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greatbritishbreaker
Reviews.Content: Well what do you say, this hotel is false advertising at its best. To start don't believe the pictures on this website apart from the front. Where things went wrong: to start we booked this hotel. next we arrived. Being constructively critical the room is of good size for me, fiance and child. The shower didn't drain which was sorted when mentioned in the morning. I called reception to ask for a TV remote, which wasn't delivered but I had to go and get? Service industry remember? Went for our advertised continental breakfast in the morning, this comprised cornflakes, soggy toast and tinned fresh! fruit salad. I'm sure those on the continent would be proud!! the juices are plentiful though not surprising considering the apple juice which i gave to my son tasted like urine?? While talking to the manager in the morning regarding the shower, I mentioned that the bed was completely knackered as we were basically sleeping on the broken divan base. He said straight away don't worry we'll change it, and guess what coming back from a long day visiting sites in London nothing had been done. Overall the location was perfect for Wembley, visiting London which was less than 20minutes on the tube. However the Â£50 per night price tag, considering where you can stay in the country for the same is a mistake i won't make again in London. Shocking enough was the breakfast but not sleeping on a comfortable bed is disgraceful. I only hope people who read this do reaslise that this is an overpriced youth hostel and nothing more. But thank you for your apologies on reception that is adequate compensation for a truely memorable stay!!!! I can only say that it is obvious that the positve reviews of this hotel have been posted by staff on the night shift

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay in this friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexJanie
Reviews.Content: We travelled to London to see Status Quo at Wembley Arena, and once again chose the Euro Wembley as our hotel of choice !! This hotel is so convenient to Wembley Central tube station, and we always feel welcome by the staff. Our room (32) although quite small, was more than adequate, with a comfortable bed, spotless linen and also a spotless ensuite shower room. Another bonus to this hotel is its quiet location - unusual for London - and much appreciated after 2 nights of partying. Also recommended is the nearby Thirsty Eddies irish bar (on way to Wembley Arena) - a bar full of characters who always make you welcome, and the karaoke Saturday night was something we will not forget in a while !! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants fantasic value for money, and convenience of location. Our room

Reviews.Title: “If you cant afford a better hotel then stay at the Euro Wembley !”
Reviews.Author: travellerstan
Reviews.Content: The check-in was quick, but that was where the joy ended ! The rooms are small and cramped, come with en-suite facility but not enough space for getting in and out of your bath. The room heating is timer controlled and does not come on till 1930 hrs and is switched off before 0630 hrs - this was a problem, since I am not acclimatised to the chilly weather. The tariff includes a continental breakfast which is just cereals(cornflakes), some fruit pulp and toast - this is hardly adequate for a long day of sightseeing or work in the CBD! The receptionist lady was busy with some day-to-day issues with her boss, who seemed to be pre occupied with running the show on a shoe-string budget...which is what the hotel seems to be. The location is very good for reaching wembley, euston road, london central business district etc. but if its a family accommodation you need, look elsewhere, business travellers can find better accommodation at the Premier Inn, or the Quality comforts hotel down the road, just a few blocks away. Internet through Wi-Fi is available only in the lobby which is roughly a 3 x 3 feet space, with 3 tables and 6 chairs thrown in along with a few beer-buddies who just dont leave the place as they are glued to a TV screen playing football matches !! There were just 2 satchets of milk, coffee powder, which may seem a bit little if you are used to working on your laptop while sipping coffee - all in all a very meagre facility. Would not recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: nyorksfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in August for an event at Wembley. It is in an ideal situation from Wembley. The rooms are dirty and very tired. The staff were rude except for the breakfast staff. There was no kettle in our room and when asked if we could have one we were told that there wasn't any in the hotel left and that there should be one in our room and we must have moved it. Only cups and and tea and coffee making stuff no kettle!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin - absolutely fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: SweetHeartScene
Reviews.Content: If you book into a 5* hotel you have certain realistic expectations just as if you book into a 1* you should also have realistic expectations. The price is usually an indicator. After looking over the other reviews on this website I think a lot of people have distorted expectations given the star rating. We checked into a twin room and the receptionist (who was European - though why other reviewers see this as a negative thing I will never know as she spoke good English and was very friendly and helpful) gave us our keys and gave us a few tips. We went up to our room which was perfectly clean. The room looks a little dated but the beds were comfortable and the room was warm. The bathroom was on the smaller side but wasn't claustrophobic. I didn't eat at the breakfast but I grabbed some juice while there and the staff were very friendly and more than happy to help and it looked nice from what I could see - standard cereal / toast sort of thing. We even checked out a little late and there was no problem at all. Cons : The walls are quite thin. This didn't stop us from sleeping at all but in the morning we enjoyed a rendition of 'fight for this love' from one of our neighbours. Pros : On the website it says it is one mile from Wembley stadium - I wouldn't say it was a mile and it's very simple to get to from there. Very friendly staff who are interested in their guests. Lots of amenities near by. Close to the tube station. Good price. On the whole I think the hotel is great for what it is. You don't pay between Â£35-Â£75 in London and expect a complimentary robe, splash room and a panoramic view from your room. As a place to lay your head after an event I think for the money is amazing considering the location!

Reviews.Title: “It was like visiting Faulty Towers Terrible Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah27London
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel last weekend while going to the X Factor on the Saturday night, we arrived at 5pm and the greeting from the staff was very unprofessional and cold it was as if we should not have been there. When i tried to check in they had to check the fax they got 3 weeks earlier to confirm my stay as i wasn't on the arrivals list i was handed 2 large old fashion room keys and told where my room was and what time breakfast was at notjing else. I get into my room to find three beds an old style tv looks about 20 years old, some towels on my bed and some drawers and a cupboard. Take a look in the bathroom and it is filthy you could see the dirt all over the tiles and in between the grout in the shower, there were no toiletries as advertised when i booked the room. The carpet was filthy and you could see a build up of dirt where it had never been hoovered, there were cobwebs all over the ceiling, the bed sheets were no better either i ended up throwing my bed sheet on the floor as i refused to lie in a flithy bed cover. The heating wasn't on when we arrived and after checking the raditors to see how to turn them on i discovered that there was no way of turning them on or even turning them down if it got to hot, decided to watch some tv only to discover the tv channels were not tuned in properly so when you thought i'll watch BBC 1 you had to spend 5 minutes working out which channel it was on as they were all muddled up and it did not have a proper arial signal. Never got any sleep as there were a lot of parties going on in the room next to us which they done nothing about, i refused to eat breakfast the next day because all i kept thinking was if the rooms were that bad imagine what was happening in the kitchen. I'm surprised i never found any cochroaches in there. Overall my stay was a total nightmare from start to finish and i would advise anyone thinking about using this hotel no matter how cheap a price it is DON'T DO IT. In my opinion i can't believe there is a hotel in London still like that they should be closed down by enviromental health and should be ashamed of the state it is in. It's a shame becuase if they actually invested more money into it and trained their staff properly it would be an ideal hotel for Wembley area but instead it's like FAULTY TOWERS ONE OF THE WORST HOTELS IN WEMBLEY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: majk88
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel and all that comes with it, quite cheap and a standard according to it (1 star). The rooms are small and so is the bathrooms. The staff is OK, helpful if you need help. We changed room because of problem with the shower. Breakfast is very simple, toast, butter, cereal.... Easy to access city centre 20 minutes by underground, hotel 300m from Wembley station. There are a lot of fastfood places close to the hotel and also a Primark (very cheap clothes). Now there should also by a Trimaxx open. If you don't expect too much this hotel is OK, you get a bed to sleep in and a place to take a shower. We might stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: annadel556
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed here after seeing take that at wembley.the location is very good as we walked back from the stadium, which took 10mins .if you needed to drive any where you'd be stuck as theres so much traffic after an event.elm road where it is is a bit grotty ,but the hotel itself is ok for the price,it was clean and the breakfast was good,breakfast staff very friendly.ideal place just to get your head down for the night.we paid Â£37 on alpha rooms so for that price it was great. buses etc liturally 2 mins away. i would go back. i think these people who slag it off want luxury and to pay peanuts for it!

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers??”
Reviews.Author: naehappymin
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I cannot say one positive thing about our stay at this "hotel." On arrival to this establishment, we were greeted by a locked door and the "friendly" cleaner's refused to acknowledge our presence. After knocking for several minutes and getting no where, I called Reception who finally came out to meet me. After waiting thirty minutes and being served a warm glass of Coke, adding approximately 200 calories to my diet, I looked up to see a "cleaner" peering over my shoulder at my finely packed suitcase full of clothes, questioning my belongings. Once we had checked in and ignored the stench billowing out of the female toilets on our way up to our room, we were met by a small, dirty room... nothing like the pictures show! (Even these are somewhat to be desired!). There was nothing appealing about this room as two of the sockets didn't produce electricity, the hair dryer we were very kindly provided with didn't produce any power, the cigarette box sized tv had five channels which was meant to have sky didnt work properly (using the remote control to change channel turned the TV off!), my bum sank in to the mattress, almost touching the floor. We were also provided with one towel each. The room was dirty so rather than use the wardrobe / cupboards provided, we lived our of our pink suitcases. The staff were unfriendly. When we said we would like to leave early, we were told we could not cancel our room for the third night unless we left that night. The walls are so thin, we could hear the person next door opening a packet of crisps. Probably Walkers Cheese and Onion. Location: Unfortunately when using the local bus service, we were picked on for closing a window which was causing a draft and messing up my friends hair. The locals made you feel about as welcome as a fart in a space suit. I would also recommend you do not go to the local Primark as it was messy and hard to find any items of clobber of the decent variety. Apart from the above, I had an enjoyable stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Euro Wembley Hotel London
HotelInfo.Address: 1-7 Elm Road, London HA9 7JA, England
